Detailed Description

XinxCodeEdit is a wrapper of a QCodeEdit editor.

This editor redefine different function used in QTextEdit and TextEditor.

Todo:

add method : undo(), redo(), cut(), copy(), paste()

delete find method, we use QDocumentSearch.

void XinxCodeEdit::commentSelectedText ( bool  uncomment = false  )  [virtual, slot]

Comment or Uncomment the selected text depending on the parrameter. If a part of a text is already (un)commented, the balise is moved to comment all the text. Warning: If you comment code with comment, the comment can be merged with code.

Parameters:
uncomment If false (by default) the text is commented, else the text is uncommented

void XinxCodeEdit::modelUpdated ( QAbstractItemModel *  model  )  [signal]

void XinxCodeEdit::moveCursor ( QDocumentCursor::MoveOperation  operation,
QDocumentCursor::MoveMode  mode = QDocumentCursor::MoveAnchor 
)

Moves the cursor by performing the given operation.

If mode is QTextCursor::KeepAnchor, the cursor selects the text it moves over. This is the same effect that the user achieves when they hold down the Shift key and move the cursor with the cursor keys.

void XinxCodeEdit::moveLineDown (  )  [slot]

Move the current line down. Swap the current line with the line after.

See also:

void XinxCodeEdit::print ( QPrinter *  printer  )  const

Convenience function to print the text edit's document to the given printer. This is equivalent to calling the print method on the document directly except that this function also supports QPrinter::Selection as print range.

bool XinxCodeEdit::processKeyPress ( QKeyEvent *   )  [protected, virtual]

Process to do when a user press a key. This method is called when the editor ask to add some text automatically. (ie: close a bracket, ...)

void XinxCodeEdit::setTabStopWidth ( int  width  ) 

Set the number of space for a tabulation. Warning: This value is global in the application. This is a limitation of QCodeEdit.

See also:
tabStopWidth()

Sets the visible cursor.

See also:

int XinxCodeEdit::tabStopWidth (  )  const
QDocumentCursor XinxCodeEdit::textCursor (  )  const

Returns a copy of the QTextCursor that represents the currently visible cursor. Note that changes on the returned cursor do not affect QTextEdit's cursor; use setTextCursor() to update the visible cursor.

See also:
setTextCursor()
QString XinxCodeEdit::textUnderCursor ( const QDocumentCursor &  cursor,
bool  deleteWord = false,
bool  dot = true 
)

Return the text who is under the cursor.

Parameters:
cursor The cursor to use to look the text.
deleteWord If true, textUnderCursor will remove the text returned.
dot If true '.' is considered in a word
